title: Will Bayley’s Strictly co-stars react as he quits show following injury
text:
Will was forced to quit Strictly (Picture: PA)

Will Bayley’s Strictly Come Dancing co-stars have shared their support after the Paralympian was forced to pull out of the show tonight, after a horrific leg injury in rehearsals left him unable to perform.

The Paralympian admitted he was ‘gutted’ to pull out, after he was given a bye through to next week’s competition after jumping off a table and collapsing on his knee.

Viewers saw brief footage of the star coiled over in pain to explain his absence, with his future on the show in doubt.

That was confirmed tonight he would not be returning as Strictly tweeted the sad news along with a statement.

Not long after, as he prepared to appear on It Takes Two alongside pro partner Janette Manrara, the hosts of Strictly’s spin-off show, Zoe Ball and Rylan Clark-Neal were the first to pay tribute to the stars as they took to Twitter.

Zoe tweeted: ‘All the love to @WillBayleytt & @JManrara,’ along with two love hearts.

Her co-host Rylan chimed in: ‘Soooo gutted for @WillBayleytt you’re amazing mate and so sad you’ve had to leave. Wishing you a speedy recovery. And to lovely @JManrara you’re simply amazing! Xxx We’re gonna miss you xxxx.’

Soon after the messages flooded in from Will’s fellow contestants and Janette’s professional colleagues.

YouTuber Saffron Barker, who is partnered with AJ Pritchard wrote: ‘Absolutely completely gutted for @WillBayleytt & @JManrara.

‘Two of the most genuine and lovely people I’ve ever met! Such an amazing team with so much potential. I will truly miss you so much Will but so glad to have found a friend in you. Get well soon.’

Dancer Aljaz Skorjanec, who is a pro on the show and is married to Janette said he was ‘gutted’ to see Will have to pull out.

‘Absolutely gutted that @WillBayleytt and my @JManrara had to pull out of @bbcstrictly,’ he wrote.

‘You had so much more to give Mr.. Hope we see each other on the dancefloor again soon. I wish you a quick recovery.

Will and Janette appeared on It Takes Two this evening (Picture: BBC)

He added: ‘And my wife… I love you and always here for you #keepdancing.’

Neil Jones wrote: ‘Sad News. @WillBayleytt u made me smile the first moment we met and I know everyone will agree that you have created some very special moments that we will never forget with @JManrara.’

He added his heart ‘goes out to you both and I wish you a speedy and full recovery. you got this Champ.’

Anneka Rice was ‘devestated’ as she chimed in online: ‘Devastated for @WillBayleytt having to pull out of #Strictly.

‘He is such a hero and has shown us all how he makes the impossible possible. He is a force of nature and an inspiration. Get better soon darling Will..’

As they shared their wishes and heartache, with show host Claudia Winkleman , Will broke his social media silence as he said: ‘Love you guys,’ alongside BBC’s statement.

Johannes Radebe replied to Will: ‘Get well soon … I will always remember your beautiful contemporary piece with the gorgeous @JManrara.’

The statement from the BBC read: ‘Sadly, due to the injury sustained last week, Will Bayley is leaving Strictly Come Dancing.’

‘I’m gutted my Strictly journey has had to come to an end,’ Will said in the statement.

‘I’ve loved being part of the show, and am so grateful for the phenomenal support we have received. I want to say a special thank you to Janette for believing in me and giving me the confidence to believe in myself. The things we achieved, from our Couple’s Choice dance through to the lifts in our Salsa, will stay with me forever. I’ve had the time of my life.’

Will’s partner Janette added: ‘Absolutely devastated that Will and I will not be able to continue dancing. We made some incredible memories that I will never forget, and I am pleased to have shared them with such an inspirational person, whom I can now call a friend for life.’

Strictly Come Dancing continues Saturday at 7pm on BBC One.
